page.title: 05PLASHETT _ HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses are owner-occupied. Little development has taken place but some refurbishment of farm houses and buildings has taken place, in keeping with the environment. The buildings generally, many of them being very old, are of traditional Sussex style, being built of red brick and tile hung. The houses not owner-occupied are usually tied cottages, some of which have been sold as private homes. Most of the farm houses are attached to working farms. Only three are non-working at the present time. The size of these houses varies from small cottages to large farm houses, mostly of the eighteenth century. Some farms have out-buildings converted for modern uses (e.g. garages)
